description:
runtime: Plan 9: fix errstr

The call to the C function runtime.findnull() requires
that we provide the argument at 0(SP).

messages.text:
Hello rsc@golang.org, rminnich@gmail.com, ality@pbrane.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

LGTM

I saw this before and after and it fixes the problem. Once I resolve whatever happened on my submit yesterday with the lost message to codereview I'll put this one in.

Boy this is annoying. The hg submit works fine. But the second step, which was working fine, just sits and asks for user name and password, as though it's got no idea of who I am. I'm not sure of how to debug this.

Anyway, I submitted this patch. I've also blown my tree away and redone all the steps, but I don't feel like fooling with it any more tonight.

On Sat, Mar 9, 2013 at 12:04 AM, <rminnich@gmail.com> wrote:

> Boy this is annoying. The hg submit works fine. But the second step,
> which was working fine, just sits and asks for user name and password,
> as though it's got no idea of who I am. I'm not sure of how to debug
> this.
>

This is a consequence of using two different systems for code:
code.google.com for the hg repo and codereview.appspot.com for reviews. The
submit is using the credentials you stored in your hgrc, which are clearly
working fine.

The second wants a standard Google account and password. The account you
use here does not have to match the account you use for hg, and the
password definitely doesn't match (since the hg password is autogenerated
garbage from code.google.com). If you choose to use an account with 2-step
verification enabled, you will need to paste in an "application-specific
password" at the prompt instead of your real password. If you use an
account without 2-step verification, you can just type your password.

Russ

On Mon, Mar 11, 2013 at 8:23 AM, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:

> This is a consequence of using two different systems for code:
> code.google.com for the hg repo and codereview.appspot.com for reviews. The
> submit is using the credentials you stored in your hgrc, which are clearly
> working fine.

yep, I had a realization a bit after sending my note that I might have
to recreate a new application specific password for "step 2".
I'm not quite sure *why* that had to happen, but some things you just accept.

I've gotten so used to gerrit that the 'two different accounts' part
of reitveld just slipped my mind.

thanks!

ron

subject: code review 7559047: runtime: Plan 9: fix errstr
